data.title: Jesus Incident by Herbert Frank Ransom Bill
data.meta_description: Le programme conscience, Tome 2 : L'incident Jésus by Herbert, Frank, Ransom, Bill and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.co.uk.
data.text:
Paperback: 7" x 4½". Condition: Near Fine: Small signs of wear. Cover Art: Fred Gambino (illustrator). 2000 Edition. © 1979: 2nd in the 'Pandora' series of books. 1st printing of 2000 edition:- Synopsis: A determined group of colonists are attempting to establish a bridgehead on the planet Pandora, despite the savagery of the native lifeforms, as deadly as they are inhospitable. But they have more to deal with than just murderous aliens: their ship's computer has been given artificial consciousness and has decided that it is a God. Now it is insisting - with all the not inconsiderable force of its impressive array of armaments to back it up - that the colonists find appropriate ways to worship it:- Review(s): "A speculative intellect with few rivals in modern SF" - Encyclopedia Of Science Fiction:- (original cost £6.99).

Condition: Good. SHIPS FROM USA. Used books have different signs of use and do not include supplemental materials such as CDs, Dvds, Access Codes, charts or any other extra material. All used books might have various degrees of writing, highliting and wear and tear and possibly be an ex-library with the usual stickers and stamps. Dust Jackets are not guaranteed and when still present, they will have various degrees of tear and damage. All images are Stock Photos, not of the actual item. book.

Kartoniert / Broschiert. Condition: New. Dieser Artikel ist ein Print on Demand Artikel und wird nach Ihrer Bestellung fuer Sie gedruckt. &Uumlber den AutorFRANK HERBERT (1920-1986) created the most beloved novel in the annals of science fiction, Dune. He was a man of many facets, of countless passageways that ran through an intricate mind. His magnum opus is a reflection.

Condition: Good. SHIPS FROM USA. Used books have different signs of use and do not include supplemental materials such as CDs, Dvds, Access Codes, charts or any other extra material. All used books might have various degrees of writing, highliting and wear and tear and possibly be an ex-library with the usual stickers and stamps. Dust Jackets are not guaranteed and when still present, they will have various degrees of tear and damage. All images are Stock Photos, not of the actual item. book.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1ST. Excellent Copy - Signed - On Behalf Of Frank Herbert, By Brian Herbert - On The Title Page. British - First Edition, First Printing. Book Is In Very Good Plus Condition. Boards Have A Tiny Bit Of Shelf Wear. Not Bumped. Fore Edges Have A Tiny Bit Of Reading Wear. Interior Is Clean And Legible. Not Remaindered. Dust Jacket Is In Very Good Plus Condition. Tiniest Bit Of Wear Along The Edges. Not Price Clipped. Dust Jacket Is Covered By Mylar Brodart. Thanks And Enjoy. Signed by Author(s). Book.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. Inscribed by Herbert on the title page. Very Good in a Very Good jacket, unclipped ($10.95), generally toned, rubbed at the edges, a few small chips. Black buckram, lightly rubbed at the edges and corners, with silver gilt lettering on the spine. Square, bound with some reading wear, foxed at the top edge, clean internally. A collaborative novel between Herbert and Ransom that is based on Herbert's Destination: Void.

First Edition. Octavo. 405 pages. This was the a long-delayed sequel to "Destination: Void", both in real time (it took 12 years) and novel time (thousands of years, possibly aeons). There are two following novels in the series: "The Lazarus Effect" and the "The Ascension Factor". The latter was his last book before his untimely death in 1986. A fine copy bound in black cloth, spine lettering silver,in a fine unclipped pictorial dust jacket. A beautiful copy.
